awards.description: BUILDING RESIGHINI RANCHERIA EXPERTISE AND DATA CAPACITY FOR CLIMATE RESILIENCY ANALYSIS AND FUTURE PLANNING

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE RESIGHINI RANCHERIA TO BUILD ITS CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS ON INDIAN LANDS. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL TRAIN STAFF, DEVELOP A QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN FOR RADON SAMPLING, DEVELOP A SOLID WASTE ORDINANCE, CONDUCT A WASTE STREAM ASSESSMENT, IDENTIFY ILLEGAL DUMPING AND TAKE ENFORCEMENT ACTIONS WHEN POSSIBLE, CONDUCT OUTREACH, AND CONDUCT A CLEANUP EVENT FOCUSING ON ELECTRONIC AND HAZARDOUS WASTES. 

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $297,869.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO THE PULIKLA TRIBE OF YUROK PEOPLE. THE RECIPIENT WILL BUILD ITS CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER AN EPA PROGRAM AND/OR IMPLEMENT SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE ACTIVITIES. THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $262,049. SEE TERMS AND CONDITIONS. 
ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PRODUCING A BI-ANNUAL NEWSLETTER, ENGAGEMENT WITH AGENCIES ON KLAMATH RIVER BASIN ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES, AND PATROLLING THE LAND FOR SOLID WASTE ORDINANCE VIOLATIONS. 

SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE NEWSLETTERS, SUMMARIES OF MEETINGS ATTENDED, AND PATROL LOGS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE REDUCED ILLEGAL DUMPING AREAS, A MORE KNOWLEDGEABLE COMMUNITY ON ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES, AND IMPROVED COMMUNICATION BETWEEN AGENCIES WORKING TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH OF THE KLAMATH BASIN. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE MEMBERS AND/OR THE RESIDENTS OF THE PULIKLA TRIBE OF YUROK PEOPLE.
